WorkItem.ClosedComment: Glad to hear uninstall/reinstall fixed the issue. We tried this setup during our testing and didn't run into any problems. Can you post any details about what you had installed on the machine (VS 2012, VS 2013, previous versions of TypeScript, etc?) so we can try to reproduce it here? Thanks!
WorkItem.Description:
Hey All,

I just installed the 0.9.5 beta release as posted [here](https://typescript.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=TypeScript%200.9.5%20beta).

When opening the following project [ToTypeScriptD](https://github.com/ToTypeScriptD/ToTypeScriptD) in VS 11 I get the following error

```
Error	2	The "TypeScript.Tasks.VsTsc" task could not be loaded from the assembly C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft\VisualStudio\v11.0\TypeScript\TypeScript.tasks.dll. Could not load file or assembly 'file:///C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft\VisualStudio\v11.0\TypeScript\TypeScript.tasks.dll' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified. Confirm that the <UsingTask> declaration is correct, that the assembly and all its dependencies are available, and that the task contains a public class that implements Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask.	C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft\VisualStudio\v11.0\TypeScript\Microsoft.TypeScript.targets	87	5	ToTypeScriptD.Tests.JavascriptTests
```

Note: I didn't try anything like un-install/re-install. Just installed over the top of whatever I had installed prior.

Any thoughts?
WorkItem.Summary: 0.9.5-beta - VsTsc assembly not found - project build issue

Comments.Message: NOTE: Uninstalling both versions and re-installing seems to have fixed the problem. (Is there a way to add in messaging to the install process to avoid this issue?)
